Classification.Classification: Elasmobranchii (sharks and rays) > Rajiformes (Skates and rays) > Rajidae (Skates)
Classification.Etymology: Leucoraja: Greek, leykos = white + Latin, raja = a fish, Raja sp. . More on author: Mitchill.

sectionData.Environment: Marine; demersal; oceanodromous ; depth range 0 - 329 m . Temperate; 49°N - 33°N, 78°W - 59°W
sectionData.Distribution: Western Atlantic: southern Gulf of St. Lawrence and Nova Scotia in Canada to North Carolina, USA.
sectionData.Biology: Usually on sandy or gravelly bottoms from shoal waters to 90 m depth , with temperature range of 1.2-21°C. Benthic . Mostly inactive during daylight, but active under dark conditions . Feeds on bottom-dwelling organisms such as crabs, shrimps, polychaetes, sea squirts, mollusks, squids and bony fishes . Oviparous. Distinct pairing with embrace. Young may tend to follow large objects, such as their mother . Eggs are oblong capsules with stiff pointed horns at the corners deposited in sandy or muddy flats . Egg capsules are 4.6-6.3 cm long and 2.7-4.8 cm wide, about 10-35 eggs are laid annually . Possesses an electric organ located in the tail region . Electric organ discharge (EOD) activity is intermittent and seemed more frequent during dark periods . The individual EOD of this species is monophasic, head-negative, and lasts 70 ms .
sectionData.Life cycle: Oviparous, paired eggs are laid. Embryos feed solely on yolk . Distinct pairing with embrace. Young may tend to follow large objects, such as their mother .
